thread.title: Middle school v-ball teams face Aldo Leopold
thread.title_full: Middle school v-ball teams face Aldo Leopold

author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: Middle school v-ball teams face Aldo Leopold
text:
Middle school v-ball teams face Aldo Leopold Oct 02, 2015 
BY ANDY KRUTSINGER 
Mt. Pleasant News 
BURLINGTON — The Mt. Pleasant middle school volleyball teams played against Aldo Leopold on Thursday night. The seventh grade Panthers hosted their games and went 1-2 with the “A” and “B” team falling and “C” team winning, while the eighth grade teams went 2-0-1 with “A” and “B” winning, and “C” splitting. 
At home, the seventh grade “A” team fell in a close one, 21-19, 18-21, 15-11. Ryann Davidson had the best day serving, going 12/12 with seven aces. The “B” team fell 21-16 and 21-13. They got aces out of Kionna Parrish, Makenna Schinstock and Maddie Milks. Schinstock had the best percentage, going 5/5. The “C” team swept, 21-14 and 22-20. Jordan Alpara went 12/13 and had 10 aces. 
In Burlington, the eighth grade “A” team swept 21-11 and 21-17 with Magie Cristoforo leading with nine points on 10/11 serving. The “B” team had a dominant win, sweeping 21-5 and 21-14. Sierra Barton went 16-16 and led with 14 points serving. The “C” team split, falling in the first game, 21-18 but winning the second. 21-13. Bailey Andrews had five points on 5-6 serving to lead the team. 
The middle school teams will play Edward Stone in their next games on Monday, Oct. 5. The eighth grade team will host, and the seventh grade team will be on the road.
